lines.text: (discussing a line of dialogue she gave in an earlier movie) I didn't ask for the anal probe.
Did they tell you I was a bitch?
On wheels.
You eat now.
What exactly is that?
Kascha. Big fiber. It's good for stool.
Yes. It looks like it has something to do with that.
Are you going to do something to get stronger?
Why would I want to do that?
Because the next one may not be so nice as me.
Right. And you're Florence fuckin' Nightingale.
I can't have sex I can feel... unless I really get into blowjobs.
[Looks at Chantelle]
Sorry. You're probably some big Christian and I just put my foot in my mouth.
It's none of my business what you put in your mouth, Ms. Culhane.
No matter where you at, there you is.
His wife's not worried.
Should she be?
Why worry about some cripple who's got a freezer compartment for a pussy.
Don't be like that.
I didn't ask for the anal probe.
[first lines]

[seeing herself in the soap opera]
It felt so strange. All I remember is that I wasn't happy. Was I?
This visit is just something my business manager cooked up with the insurance company.
Am I going to meet this guy, this business manager?
I'm out of business.

[to her nurse is cleaning]
It's important that we have clean walls. I'll be climbing them soon.

[to her new house nurse]
You been doing this long?
No. You?
I am not ready for this. When I get stronger I will quit drinking.
If you keep drinking you won't get any stronger.
Did you ever fall in love with a married man?

[about photograph]
It's easier to get a smile out of an alligator than it is to get one from your mother.
[last lines]
Chantelle...
Yeah?
You *are* going to have to learn how to cook.

[Regarding May-Alice's uncle]
He's
[pause]
literary.
I need a drink.
That's too bad.
